title: I was in an at fault accident and the plaintiff is sueing exceeding my policy.
question: I was in an accident over a year ago and found out that my insurance is refusing to pay out the other driver who i was in an accident with. They are telling me that the plaintiffs attourney is trying to milk them for maximum policy amount and they refusing to do that because I was at fault. Is that legal for insurance companies to do that knowing that the plaintiff can come for me? Also i don’t own any assets, a car, a home, or let alone a bank account, no job , unemployed pretty much $40 to my name... do i tell the plaintiffs attourney that I’m going to be homeless soon anyways and that i will just file Bankruptcy anyways? Will that make them happy to pursue this? Like how will they get money.
answers:
As long as the money you owe is not criminal fines or restitution it will be dischargable in bankruptcy
To properly answer your questions and address your concerns, the best way to handle this is with an in person consultation with an experienced CA bankruptcy attorney. Use AVVO's Find a Lawyer tool to select a qualified attorney. Good luck. THIS IS NOT LEGAL ADVICE! YOU NEED TO SPEAK TO AN ATTORNEY WHO IS LICENSED IN YOUR STATE FOR LEGAL ADVICE. This is merely suggestions for you to think about in discussing your situation with the local attorney.

Unless you were under the influence of alcohol or drugs when you caused the accident, you should be able to discharge your personal liability for the accident in a bankruptcy. Yoou may also be able to sue the insurance company for bad faith. See a bankruptcy attorney for the bankruptcy and a lawyer who specializes in suing insurance companies on the other matter.
